Uses of Class
emissary.util.shell.TempFileNames

  • Packages that use TempFileNames 
    Package Description
    emissary.util.shell
    Utilities for controlling external processes, including getting the output, creating temp files and directories and a lot of the other stuff that ProcessBuilder (johnny-come-lately) can do.

    • Uses of TempFileNames in emissary.util.shell

      Methods in emissary.util.shell that return TempFileNames 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      TempFileNames Executrix.createTempFilenames()
      Creates a set of temp file names (does not do any disk activity)
      TempFileNames Executrix.writeInputDataToNewTempDir​(byte[] data)
      Write data out for processing into a new subdir under our configured temp area
      TempFileNames Executrix.writeInputDataToNewTempDir​(byte[] data, int start, int len)
      Write data out for processing into a new subdir under our configured temp area
      Methods in emissary.util.shell with parameters of type TempFileNames 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      String[] Executrix.getCommand​(TempFileNames tmpNames)
      Gets the value of command that this instance will execute adding configured limits and supplied paths to the configuration value
      String[] Executrix.getCommand​(TempFileNames tmpNames, String commandArg)
      Gets the value of a command that can be executed adding configured limits and supplied paths to the configuration value
      String[] Executrix.getCommand​(TempFileNames tmpNames, String commandArg, int cpuLimit, int vmSzLimit)
      Gets the value of a command that can be executed adding supplied limits and supplied paths to the configuration value The values in the command string that can be replaced are <INPUT_PATH>, <OUTPUT_PATH>, <INPUT_NAME>, and <OUTPUT_NAME>.
